name: Baseflow Index (BFI) vs Baseline
functionStatement: Ensures habitat availability and water quality during low water levels, and indicates non-storm conditions experienced the majority of the time.
descriptionMarkdown: Degree to which residual pools and riffle segments remain linked by continuous surface flow along the thalweg at normal low flow.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Compute Baseflow Index from daily flow records and compare to a regional or historical baseline where available.

inputs.label: Baseflow Index (BFI) vs Baseline
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: BFI closely matches the region's baseline. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: About 10-20% difference from baseline. (Suggested index range 0.50-0.69)

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: About 20-40% difference from baseline. (Suggested index range 0.30-0.49)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: More than 40% difference from baseline, indicating extreme baseflow alteration. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.29)

references: USGS Groundwater Toolbox (BFI+, PART/WHAT/BASEFLOW) and/or USGS EflowStats
